event.title: Music As A Weapon IV Festival
event.description: Disturbed is launching the Music As A Weapon IV Festival. Although the Chicago quartet conceived Music As A Weapon in 2001 and have headlined the previous three tours, this is the first time that it has been expanded into a complete lifestyle festival. In addition to presenting the best in rock music, Music As A Weapon IV also features a collection of the greatest tattoo artists from around the country. Attendees will also be able to check out an extreme sports complex where freestyle motocross, BMX, and Skate teams will perform, a Technology and Gaming Zone, and a Vendor Village, all for a fan-friendly ticket price.

event.title: Music As A Weapon IV
event.description: Are you from the Dallas/Fort Worth area? Would youlike to be informed about EVERY metal show coming to town?Well then, visit The Metal Times (www.dfwmetal.webs.com), and also sign up to the mailing list (metaltimes.dfw@gmail.com).

event.title: Music As a Weapon
event.description:
Disturbed is a rock band from Chicago, Illinois, formed in 1996 when musicians Dan Donegan, Steve "Fuzz" Kmak, and Mike Wengren hired singer David Draiman. Since the band's formation, they have sold over 10 million albums worldwide, released three consecutive number-one albums, and have been nominated for a Grammy Award, making them one of the most successful rock bands in the recent years. Only six other rock bands have released three number-one albums in a row, including Van Halen, Pearl Jam, U2, Dave Matthews Band, Staind, and Metallica.

Lacuna Coil is an Italian gothic metal band formed in Milan, Italy in 1994. Formerly known as Sleep of Right and Ethereal, the band was inspired by the combination of gothic imagery and music, and the members have been known, musically, for composing midtempo songs consisting of guitar lines overlaid with prominent keyboard work, and contrasting dual female/male vocal harmonies to help create a melodic detached sound. Much of the band's recent material, however, sees a heavier and more down-tuned style, featuring a more distinct bass line and a higher mixing of the guitars within the songs.

The band's 2006 release, Karmacode peaked at number 28 on the Billboard 200. They have played among the world's biggest heavy metal festivals on the main stage including Ozzfest, Bloodstock Open Air, Wacken Open Air, and played with Megadeth on their Gigantour tour in November 2007, and are currently on tour with Bullet for My Valentine.

Killswitch Engage (often abbreviated as KsE or Killswitch) is an American metalcore band from Westfield, Massachusetts. Formed following the disbandment of the bands Overcast and Aftershock in 1999, Killswitch Engage's lineup consists of vocalist Howard Jones, bassist Mike D'Antonio, guitarists Joel Stroetzel and Adam Dutkiewicz, and drummer Justin Foley. Signed to Roadrunner Records, Killswitch Engage has released four studio albums and one DVD.

Killswitch Engage rose to fame with its 2004 release The End of Heartache, which peaked at number 21 on the Billboard 200, and was certified gold in December 2007 for over 500,000 shipments in the United States. The title track, "The End of Heartache", was nominated for a Grammy Award in 2005, and a live DVD titled (Set This) World Ablaze was released in 2005. Killswitch Engage attended Reading and Leeds Festivals, Ozzfest, Download Festival, the Warped Tour, and Rock on the Range, and continued touring until May of 2008 in support of their As Daylight Dies album.

Chimaira (pronounced /kaɪˈmɪərə/) is a heavy metal band from Cleveland, Ohio and is a notable band in the New Wave of American Heavy Metal. The name is derived from the name "Chimera", which refers to a monstrous creature in Greek mythology.

event.title: MUSIC AS A WEAPON IV
event.description:
“Fresh off their headlining North American tour in support of their platinum album Indestructible, Grammy-nominated hard-rock band Disturbed will launch the Music As A Weapon IV Tour—a music, tattoo, and lifestyle festival—presented by Samsung Mobile and powered by Sprint.

Musical performances by Disturbed, Killswitch Engage, Laguna Coil and Chimaira.

event.title: Music as a Weapon IV
event.description: good time good music

event.title: Music As A Weapon Tour IV
event.description:
Multi-platinum hard-rock band Disturbed announce the lineup for the second stage of its Music As A Weapon IV Tour—a music, tattoo, and lifestyle festival—presented by Samsung Mobile and powered by Sprint. Suicide Silence, Spineshank, Bury Your Dead, Crooked X, Born of Osiris, and After the Burial are confirmed to perform on The Ernie Ball Second Stage, which will be officially sponsored by multi-city battle of the bands organization, Headbang For the Highway. Disturbed will be joined on the 38-city, nine-week trek, which kicks off March 20th in Madison, WI, by Killswitch Engage, Lacuna Coil, and Chimaira on the main-stage. Suicide Silence will join the tour on March 29th, while Bury Your Dead joins on March 31st. Both bands appear through the end of the tour. Born of Osiris and After the Burial will appear from March 20th through March 28th. Crooked X will perform on all dates.

Headbang For The Highway has teamed up with Music As A Weapon IV to offer local bands the ultimate opportunity: a spot performing on The Ernie Ball Second Stage. Two unsigned regional acts will open the show in each city the tour visits. These acts will be determined by who wins the battle of the bands competition in each city.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-Main Stage-

* Disturbed
* Killswitch Engage
* Lacuna Coil
* Chimaira

-Second Stage-

* Suicide Silence - Joins the tour March 29
* Spineshank
* Crooked X
* Bury Your Dead - Joins the tour March 31
* Battle of the Bands Winner [TBD in each city]

event.title: Greenfield Festival

artists.artist: ...And You Will Know Us by the Trail of Dead

event.description:
Tickets: http://www.eventim.ch/portal/de/konzerte/open_air/greenfield_festival_2009/58976/

Zu Slipknot, Korn, Disturbed, Social Distortion, Flogging Molly, Gogol Bordello, Volbeat, ...and you will know us by the trail of dead, Tomte, Trivium, Caliban und August Burns Red, kommen neu dazu:
Monster Magnet, The Wombats, The Subways, Soulfly, Dragonforce, Gallows, Karamelo Santo und Itchy Poopzkid!

Das Greenfield Festival gehört zu den wichtigsten Festivals der Schweiz. Es wurde zum nationalen Mekka der neuen und alten Musikszene.

Das einzige konzeptionelle Rockmusikfestival in der Schweiz garantiert auch 2009 puren Musikgenuss inmitten einer beeindruckenden Bergwelt. Fürs Greenfield Festival gibt es ausschliesslich Dreitagespässe. Campieren auf dem Gelände, Shuttle vom Bahnhof und die Parkplätze sind für die Besucher gratis!

event.title: Disturbed
event.description:
Gotovo desetljeće nakon objavljivanja njihovog debi albuma, „The Sickness“, Disturbed su postali jedni od najboljih i veoma poštovanih bendova na hard-rock sceni, pouzdan izvor ne samo moćnih rifova i nabijajućih beatova, već i osobnih političkih uvida u ovo nemirno doba. Ipak uspjeh (u obliku tri platinum-plus albuma, s oba „Believe“ i „Ten Thousand Fists“ na vrhu Billboardove ljestvice i više od devet milijuna prodanih albuma) nije otupio njihovu sklonost ka avanturi. U povodu njihovog četvrtog albuma, „Indestructible“, frontman David Draiman, gitarist Dan Donegan i bubnjar Mike Wengren su odlučili uzeti stvar u svoje ruke i sami isproducirati album.

"Nakon tri ploče s Johnny K-om naučili smo puno", kaže Draiman za industrijskog veterana, glavnog producenta na „The Sickness“, „Believe“ i „Ten Thousand Fists“. "Uvijek se pokušavamo razviti i isprobati nove stvari i eksperimente", dodaje Donegan. "tako da smo ovaj put htjeli odraditi stvari malo drugačije." Wengren kaže da je „Indestructible“ bendu pružio priliku da dokažu sebi i svim ostalima kako oni to mogu." Rezultat njihovog eksperimentiranja u studiju je najmračniji, najagresivniji album do sad.

"Htjeli smo se vratiti na neke od elemenata koji su možda nedostajali na posljednja dva albuma", kaže Donegan. "David ima veliku sposobnost pjevati zaista melodično, ali htjeli smo da se vrati na ritmičku, animalističku, brzu energiju po kojoj je poznat. I mi smo mu htjeli pružiti glazbu koja bi to izvukla od njega“.

Koncert će se održati 17.6.2009. u klubu Boogaloo. Cijene ulaznica: 160 kn do 17.5. / 180 kn od 18.5. / 190 kn na dan.
Prodajna mjesta: Integral (pothodnik), Boogaloo, Eventim

event.title: Southside Festival 2009

artists.artist: Nick Cave and the Bad Seeds

event.description:
TIckets: http://southside.de/tickets/

Das Southside startete in den Festival-Sommer zum ersten Mal 1999 – damals noch auf dem Flugplatz in Neubiberg. 2008 fand es nun zum zehnten Mal in Folge auf einem 800m hoch gelegenen Plateau in Neuhausen ob Eck in der Nähe von Tuttlingen statt…

Neuhausen ob Eck liegt zwischen München, Stuttgart und Freiburg, nicht allzuweit vom Bodensee entfernt. (www.southside.de)


Das Southside ist ein Musikfestival mit Schwerpunkt Alternative Rock, das seit 1999 jährlich stattfindet. Seit 2000 ist das Festival in Neuhausen ob Eck bei Tuttlingen (Baden-Württemberg) auf einem ehemaligen Bundeswehrflugplatz (EDSN) beheimatet, das erste Southside hatte zuvor ebenfalls auf einem ehemaligen Militärflugplatz in Neubiberg bei München stattgefunden.

Die Bezeichnung Southside leitet sich vom Englischen south side ab, was soviel wie südliche Seite bedeutet und auf die Lage des Festivals im Süden Deutschlands hinweist. Gleichzeitig findet in Norddeutschland das ältere Schwester-Festival Hurricane statt, welches größtenteils das selbe Lineup aufweist.

Veranstaltet werden die Zwillingsfestivals vom deutschen Konzertveranstalter FKP Scorpio und der KOKO & DTK Entertainment GmbH. (http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Southside)

In English:

The Southside Festival, also just Southside, is a music festival that takes place near Tuttlingen, southern Germany, usually every June. It is promoted by German private music television channel VIVA, which belongs to Viacom, the MTV Network’s parent company, since the end of 2004. The festival and its guests are generally associated with the alternative part of mainstream music, although the festival has been becoming more and more mainstream over the years.

The Hurricane Festival, often referred to as the mother of Southside, takes place on the same three days in the very north of Germany (contrary to Southside, which is in the very south). Together they’re a twin festival, since they are on the same days and usually have the same lineup with only few exceptions.

After the great success of the Hurricane Festival, FKP Scorpio decided to make a similar event in the south of Germany. 1999 a former military airbase in Neubiberg, near Munich, was selected. In 2000 the festival was moved to another former military airbase, this time in Neuhausen ob Eck, which is near Freiburg and Stuttgart.

Because of the relative proximity to other countries (France, Austria, Switzerland and Liechtenstein are all less than 100km away), the audience is very multinational. In 2003, the calculated maximum capacity of around 40.000 people was reached and the festival has been sold out well in advance since. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Southside_Festival)

event.title: Hurricane Festival 2009

artists.artist: Nick Cave and the Bad Seeds

event.description:
Das Hurricane Festival ist ein seit 1997 auf der Motorrad-Sandrennbahn Eichenring bei Scheeßel stattfindendes Musikfestival. Mit seinen über 50.000 Besuchern jährlich (2001 und 2005 sogar um 60.000, 2008 mit 70.000 ausverkauft) zählt es zu den größten Musikfestivals in Deutschland. Gleichzeitig mit dem „Schwesterfestival“ Southside wird es jeweils am vorletzten Juni-Wochenende von der FKP Scorpio Konzertproduktionen GmbH und KoKo Konstanz GmbH veranstaltet. Wie viele andere großen Festivals setzt das Hurricane auf eine Mischung aus Rock, Alternative und Pop, wobei neben etablierten Stars auch Neulinge zum Zuge kommen.
(http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hurricane_Festival)

The Hurricane Festival, also just Hurricane, is a music festival that takes place in Scheeßel near Bremen, Germany, usually every June. It is promoted by German private music television channel VIVA, which belongs to Viacom, the MTV Network's parent company, since the end of 2004.
(http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hurricane_Festival)

event.title: Graspop Metal Meeting 2009
event.description:
The 14th edition of the annual metal fest is scheduled for the last weekend of June. The place to be is still the festival grounds of the Boeretang in Dessel. The concept remains identical: 3 days of metal mania, 4 stages, 70 bands, metal market, festival fair, side animation, signing sessions and much more! Confirmed bands will be announced on the website as soon as possible.
- the graspop website.
